article: I was on the bus heading to the airport to visit my parents over the holidays. Knowing that there was a bit of time before my _ , I was enjoying a newspaper on the bus when I noticed a gentleman 22 _ a young mother who was traveling alone with a baby and didn't seem to know  _ she needed to go. The man asked me which _ I would go through to board the plane. After realizing I was headed in the _ direction, he decided he would help the mother himself. At our stop I _ the man had two young boys and his own share of _ to deal with, but he was still trying to help the mother. So I _ to take her from there and the man thanked me, leaving for his own flight. The mother showed me her _ and I noticed that her flight 30 _ in 10 minutes and she had a handcart and a _ which was the size of my bag. There was no time to lose. She gave me her ticket and I took the suitcase while she _ the handcart. It was at this time that it occurred to me how much _ she had in me. We were running to the gate and I was  _ looking back to see if she was still _ me. As we ran up to the gate I asked the attendants whether the gate was still _ and they said yes. I gave them _ boarding pass and said goodbye. What _ me most of the adventure was seeing the look of _ on her face and hearing her say in broken English, "God bless you." Needless to say, as I rushed back to my gate on the other side out of breath, I couldn't stop smiling.
